document.masterDocTitle: Planeocoris, a new genus of Stenopodainae (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae) from Madagascar

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Planeocoris, a new genus of Stenopodainae (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae) from Madagascar

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material:
Holotype – Macropterous male: Madagascar Est / envir. de Perinet / concess. R. Izouard / 7 /
10-11 -1967
, 1025m / p.Viatte et P. Griveaud [printed]; S. 32 [handwritten]; New Genus [handwritten; red letters] / det. Rédei D., 2008 [printed]; Holotype [printed on red label]; Planeocoris / redeii n. sp. [handwritten] / det. D. Chłond 2009 [printed].

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Planeocoris redeii
sp. nov.
, holotype, dorsal habitus.

FIGURES 2–14.
Planeocoris redeii
sp. nov.
, holotype: 2—pygophore, ventral view; 3—pygophore, middle process, lateral view; 4—right paramere, outer view; 5—right paramere, lateral view; 6—right paramere, inner view; 7—left paramere, outer view; 8—left paramere, lateral view; 9—left paramere, inner view; 10—phallus, left lateral view; 11— phallus, right lateral view; 12—phallus, frontal view; 13—phallus, dorsal view; 14— phallus, posterior view.

FIGURES 15 –17.
Planeocoris redeii
sp. nov.
, holotype: 15—dorsal view; 16—lateral view; 17—ventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Measurements (in mm): Body length: 17.4 ; maximum width of abdomen: 6.3 ; head length: 1.9 ; head width: 1.5 ; length of anteocular part: 0.85 ; length of postocular part: 0.5 ; length of synthlipsis: 0.7 ; interocellar distance: 0.25 ; length of antennal segments I:II:III:IV: 0.9 : 1.7 : 0.85 : missing; length of labial segments I:II:III: 1.05 : 1.0: 0.85 ; maximum length of anterior pronotal lobe: 1.9 ; maximum length of posterior pronotal lobe: 1.35 ; maximum width of anterior pronotal lobe: 2.5 ; maximum width of posterior pronotal lobe: 3.9 ; length of scutellum: 1.4 ; length of hemelytra: 12.0.
Etymology : It is a pleasure to dedicate this new species to Dávid Rédei, heteropterist, who selected this specimen from undeterminated materials of the Muséum National d’Histoire Naturelle, Paris.
